post_text: Juneteenth commemorates the end of slavery in the United States. Abraham Lincoln's signing of the Emancipation Proclamation on January 1, 1863, marked the end of slavery. However, it wasn't until the Confederacy surrendered in April 1865 that freedom was granted to slaves in the South. The news didn't travel as quickly as it does today. On June 19, 1865, Major General Gordon Granger landed in Galveston, Texas, and announced the Confederate surrender marking the total abolition of US slavery. Today, we celebrate the end of slavery and recognize the value and worth of every human being!

post_text: Last year, Brunswick City Schools applied for and was awarded a $35,000 Positive Behavior Interventions and Supports (PBIS) Climate Transformation Grant. PBIS Rewards celebrates behavior by recognizing students when making positive choices. PBIS makes a difference!! Research shows teaching behavioral expectations and focusing on good behavior encourages students to do the right thing. In Brunswick City Schools, our students are the center of everything we do. Watching them thrive and grow through positive reinforcement has been so rewarding! Today, school district employees attended the final expanded training session funded by the Climate Transformation Grant. The workshop focused on helping our PBIS trainers share the skills they learned with the rest of their building team. This information will be presented during professional development in May. We are grateful for the additional resources to help equip our staff better serve our students!

It is our goal to gain as much input as possible as we transition to the new Brunswick Middle School. We are surveying staff, creating volunteer groups to analyze data, meeting as a whole middle school staff in order to facilitate a positive, cohesive culture, talking to student groups in order to gather input from our kids, and we are also hoping to gather input from our parents. We want to keep all ideas, concerns and possible solutions, on our radar.

post_text: This week is Character Week at Visintainer. The students have been taking part in various activities to help them think about their own character. Earlier this week students worked on a “periodic table of character traits” which listed traits that represent Brunswick PRIDE (Performance, Respect, Integrity, Determination, and Effort). They also watched videos related to technology and bullying. Today students presented videos they created to describe how they can be a positive influence on social media and why they should limit their screen time to do other fun activities!
